snippet: Ukraine’s failure to enforce its own ultimatums and its appeal to the United Nations to send peacekeepers laid bare a grim reality for the shaky government in Kiev.
abstract: Ukraine’s failure to enforce its own ultimatums and its appeal to United Nations to send peacekeepers lays bare grim reality for the shaky government in Kiev; political leaders and security forces have few reliable ways to confront Russian-backed separatists in restive east.

byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Slovyansk, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s failure to enforce its own ultimatums and its appeal to the United Nations to send peacekeepers laid bare a grim reality for the shaky government in Kiev.

headline.main: Ukraine Falters in Drive to Curb Unrest in East
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Falters in Drive to Curb Unrest in East
